item.description:
Capital Community College invites you The New England Film and Music Festival Film Preview Screening on Saturday May 11, 2013.

Join us for a Comedy and Action Short Film block at noon followed by a Horror and Suspense Short Film Block at 2pm.

All the Films and Music submitted to The New England Film and Music Festival are chosen by the viewerâ€™s vote -which ensures that the best quality Films and Music are chosen.

Film fans are encouraged to vote for their favorite film after watching Film trailers at www.NEFilmFest.com, and vote from a smart phone after watching the films at the screening events.

Local Filmmakers have created most of these short films, and students are encourage to submit their films to The New England Film and Music Festival.

All of these featured short films have been voted into the Festival by film fans, and some of these films have won awards at other Film Festivals including The Boston Student Short Film Festival and the Trinity Film Festival in Hartford.

The New England Film and Music Festival screens feature and short film selections across the region, and most films have New England roots. The Festival culminates in a final program for 2013 on September 28th at the Wadsworth Atheneum Museum of Art in Hartford Connecticut, which is the oldest public art museum in United States.

Films start at noon at:

Capital Community College
950 Main Street
Hartford, CT 06103

Centinel Hill HallAuditorium located on the 11th Floor

FREE Parking in Capital Community College Columbus Blvd Lot
and FREE On-Street Parking

General Admission is only $5 per short film block

For Film Schedule and to watch Film Trailers, please visit www.CCC.NEFilmFest.com
item.how_to_find_us: Centinel Hill Hall Auditorium located on the 11th Floor

group.name: Connecticut Theatre Group Arts-Theater Events Group Discount

item.name: The New England Film Festival Preview Screening at Capital Community College
